definition: to be able to accomodate/to have room for/to be able to put (sth) down
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
lit. can pick it up or put it down (idiom)/fig. to take what comes/to meet gains or losses with equanimity
pinyin: na2 de5 qi3 fang4 de5 xia4

definition: not to have room to put sth/to be unable to let go
lit. can pick it up or put it down (idiom)/fig. to take what comes/to meet gains or losses with equanimity
pinyin: na2 de5 qi3 fang4 de5 xia4

definition: to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to hold/to admit/to accommodate/to tolerate
optimistic/sanguine/generous/magnanimous/open-minded
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
to give up/to part with
to make a decision when it's time to decide
free and at ease/natural/unconstrained
to have no cares/to be carefree
magnanimous/generous (in spirit)
to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
